Annotation.String: This is the schema definition for the FoDKey resource. It represents the properties of a FoDKey.
Indicates if the protocol is enabled or disabled
The value of this property shall contain the enabled status of the protocol. The value shall be true if enabled and false if disabled.
Configure the IMM LDAP authorization setting.
Indicate whether the LDAP client is to be authorized by the LDAP server or locally.
This used for configure LDAP servers.
Users can configure the LDAP servers.
Configure the IMM LDAP Root distinguished name setting.
IMM uses the 'ROOT DN' field in Distinguished Name format as root entry of directory tree.This DN will be used as the base object for all searches.
Configure the IMM LDAP UID search attribute setting.

This search request must specify the attribute name used to represent user IDs on that server.On Active Directory servers, this attribute name is usually sAMAccountName. On Novell eDirectory and OpenLDAP servers, it is usually uid. If this field is left blank, it defaults to uid.
Before the LDAP server can be searched or queried, a bind request must be sent. This parameter controls how this initial bind to the LDAP server is performed.
Users can configure the LDAP servers.
Configure the IMM LDAP active directory setting.
Configure the IMM LDAP active directory setting.
Configure the IMM LDAP Group Filter setting.

This field is used for group authentication, limited to 511 characters, and consists of one or more group names. Note that Enhanced role-based security for Active Directory Users must be disabled for this setting to take effect.
Configure the IMM LDAP Group Search Attribute setting.

This field is used by the search algorithm to find group membership infomation for a specific user. Note that Enhanced role-based security for Active Directory Users must be disabled for this setting to take effect. If this field is left blank, it will default to memberof.
Configure the IMM LDAP Login Permission Attribute setting.

When a user successfully authenticates via a LDAP server, it is necessary to retrieve the login permissions for this user. In other to retrieve these permissions, the search filter sent to the server must specify the attribute name associated with login permissions. Note that Enhanced role-based security for Active Directory Users must be disabled for this setting to take effect. If this field is left blank, the user will be assigned a default of read-only permissions, assuming user and group authertication passes.
This setting affects how LDAP Servers are found, either using DNS or pre-configured servers.
The LDAP servers to be used for authentication can either be manually configured or discovered dynamically via DNS SRY records.
Configure LDAP Server 1 Host Name or IP Address.
This is only active under using Pre-Configured LDAP servers. You must configure at least one LDAP server.
Configure LDAP Server 1 Port number.

The port number for each server is optional. If this field is left blank, the default value of 389 is used for nonsecured LDAP connections. For secured connections, the default value is 636. This is only active under using Pre-Configured LDAP servers.
Configure LDAP Server 2 Host Name or IP Address.
This is only active under using Pre-Configured LDAP servers. You must configure at least one LDAP server.
Configure LDAP Server 2 Port number.

The port number for each server is optional. If this field is left blank, the default value of 389 is used for nonsecured LDAP connections. For secured connections, the default value is 636. This is only active under using Pre-Configured LDAP servers.
Configure LDAP Server 3 Host Name or IP Address.
This is only active under using Pre-Configured LDAP servers. You must configure at least one LDAP server.
Configure LDAP Server 3 Port number.

The port number for each server is optional. If this field is left blank, the default value of 389 is used for nonsecured LDAP connections. For secured connections, the default value is 636. This is only active under using Pre-Configured LDAP servers.
Configure LDAP Server 4 Host Name or IP Address.
This is only active under using Pre-Configured LDAP servers. You must configure at least one LDAP server.
Configure LDAP Server 4 Port number.

The port number for each server is optional. If this field is left blank, the default value of 389 is used for nonsecured LDAP connections. For secured connections, the default value is 636. This is only active under using Pre-Configured LDAP servers.
Configure the IMM LDAP Client DNS Search Domain.
This is only active under using DNS to find LDAP servers. If you choose to discover the LDAP servers dynamically, you will need to specify the search domain to be used.
Configure the IMM LDAP Binding Method setting.
There are three options, Anonymous Bind, Bind with Configured Credentials or Bind using Login Credentials.
Configure the IMM LDAP Client distinguished name setting.
Fill in the Client Distinguished Name(DN) to be used for the initial bind. Note that LDAP Binding Method must be set to 'Bind with Configured Credentials'.
Enter a password for the distinguished client.
Note that LDAP Binding Method must be set to 'Bind with Configured Credentials'.
Enable enhanced role-based security for Active Directory Users.
Indicate whether endable enhanced role-based security for Active Directory Users.
Configure the IMM LDAP server Target Name setting.
Note that Enhanced role-based security for Active Directory Users must be enabled for this setting to take effect.
Configure the IMM LDAP server Forest Name setting.
In order to discover Global Catalogs (GC), the forest name must be configured.
Authorization will be done in LDAP Server.
Authorization will be done locally using AOM.
Use Pre-Configured LDAP servers.
Use DNS to Find LDAP servers.
Anonymous Bind.
Bind with Configured Credentials.
Bind using Login Credentials
